intro: Siphonoglossa sessilis, commonly known as the sessile siphonoglossa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Paraguay. The plant is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a hairy texture. Siphonoglossa sessilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
